summary:
Jamen is the Vice President of Product at Lucence. He is currently based in the Netherlands, working on advancing commercial developments between Singapore and the United States. His previous portfolio included working with the manufacturing team to scale and commercialise breakthrough medical devices under Lucence's technology. His priority lies in rapid product commercialisation - to take opportunities and win new customers. He led the successful expansion to Hong Kong and grew sales and marketing for Singapore. 

Jamen lives for the startup adventure. He previously founded four companies across various industries such as medical logistics, travel, education and events management! His curiosity for left-field exploration led him to speak 5 languages including Bahasa Indonesia and French. If you find Jamen mumbling to himself, learning a new language through phonetics, hit him up ~ he loves a great conversational partner!   

Lucence shines the guiding light for physicians & patients who are working through the cancer journey. In every stage of cancer care from risk assessment to diagnosis of cancer-driving mutations, Lucence's blood-based genomic profile provides a non-invasive, painless and affordable option for individuals and cancer patients.

profile_positions.description:
Covid-19 is a life-time opportunity for me to wear multiple hats as the lead of a young & hungry team with little manufacturing experience. Our objective is to figure the fastest way to commercialise ready IP on hand to face a mounting healthcare and supply chain crisis under siege  - to figure out where to play, and how to win. 

The team rose to the challenge with record time EN:ISO 13485 accreditation. We setup the Lucence manufacturing facility and laid the robust roadmap for future medical device productisation. Lucence's ability to rapidly scale novel medical devices production allows us to navigate regulatory uncertainties of new products yet tap fleeting opportunities as they appear. We worked tirelessly to put these products out to the world including SAFER Inactivating Specimen Collection Kits and DeepMARK Next Generation Sequencing Kit.  

This episode (ongoing) is an unprecedented opportunity in the history of medical device companies. With Lucence, I have the privilege to work alongside some of the best in Singapore to rapidly scale, produce and commercialise technology and save lives.
profile_positions.title: Vice President, Product

profile_positions.description: After successful entry of the Hong Kong market, it is managed by a committed team tasked with evangelizing access to precision medicine in modern care. I turn my focus to working alongside the commercial team in Singapore to roll out Lucence's tests in the R&D pipeline. The tests included Inherited Cancers Germline Testing and Nasopharyngeal Cancer Test using Epstein Barr Virus. We worked to expand commercial channels for screening services in this geographically small but immensely valuable market.
profile_positions.title: Director, Business Development

profile_positions.description:
The Hong Kong oncology market was a tough but a fair challenge. The objective was to setup a commercial presence within a city as the stepping board for northbound expansion into Greater China. 

I started the team with support from the Singapore office. We walked the ground for months and eventually penetrated the market to win the trust of users who are famously for being meticulous - the oncologists. This laid the ground work for a team to serve as supporting presence in East Asia.
profile_positions.title: Market Lead, Hong Kong

profile_positions.description:
As an early stage startup, the main priority was to work with the team to ensure that key value propositions of Liquid Biopsy, was properly conveyed to the users. Foundational work is laid to ensure commercial presence online, marketing and operational roadblocks were resolved to garner early adopters of this promising and life-saving technology. 

Lucence was founded in 2016 with the vision of solving the most complex diagnostic problems in medicine through the most innovative technology design possible. At Lucence, I work with a team of exceptional individuals committed to a single cause: to fight cancer. The Lucence team believes that making the most informed decision possible leads to better outcomes for all patients and delivers the highest quality services through relentless innovation.
profile_positions.title: Director of Marketing

profile_positions.description: Makedemy (www.makedemy.com) is a maker education company that conceptualise and create learning experiences via purposeful making. At Makedemy, we work with both local and international schools to create curriculum and lessons that nurture values of Growth Mindset, Craftsmanship and Open Sharing among the students.
profile_positions.title: Cofounder, CEO

profile_positions.description:
I manage the corporate sales wing of the business - analysing, prospecting and reaching out to the target segments. We pioneered the Kids Road Safety Program where children as young as 4 learn to drive and be responsible pedestrians via a real driving experience. I'm happy to announce that we have reached out to more than 50 institutions annually and have impacted more than 15,000 bubs till date.  This program is currently partnered with AIG Limited as we push for safer road user knowledge for our next generation. 

Apart from product and corporate sales development, I am also involved with all digital marketing activities and creation within the company. It is important for a small company to "know where to fight, and how to win" , and therefore we looked very closely at strategising how we stretch the marketing budget on Google Adwords as well as various other online marketing channels o that we increase the quality of our onsite traffic. The team works closely to ensure the monthly marketing initiatives are aligned to the monthly growth objectives and targets set by the management.

As of March 2017, we have sold the company to a wedding planning firm to have the services integrated as part of their larger plans. I am currently pursuing interest in the area of Maker Education via Makedemy. 

Singapore Toy Club believes in Delivering Joy to every child we touch. Every kid should be themselves during their Big Day and that means, being full of smiles, laughter and anticipation for what the party brings - and that is Fun. Lots of them. At Singapore Toy Club, we provide the largest range of Bouncy Castles and Battery Operated Rides in Singapore.

Delivering Joy - http://www.SingaporeToyClub.com

From leasing of Bouncy Castles to home parties and corporate events, we have grown the competency to design and manufacture of inflatables with some notable projects being showcased at the National Heritage Board during the annual Children's Festival.
profile_positions.title: Cofounder, CEO

profile_positions.description:
OneMaker Group brings together Makers, Designers, Hardware and Software Developers to bring forward a brand new innovation movement in Asia. We believe that the maker movement in Singapore is unique and is a force for innovation where one puts their hands to create solutions that can make an impact through entrepreneurship. Establishing the first publicly accessible makerspace in Singapore - The Prototyping Lab @ National Design Centre, this is the heart of hardware entrepreneurship where one can find access to tools and like-minded people to work together.  

Specialising in Technology Education, Prototyping, Community Events and Makerspaces - OneMaker Group (OMG) is supported by Spring Singapore and is a joint venture between 6 companies namely including Sustainable Living Labs (SL2) and Home-Fix D.I.Y. We are a strong hardware community partner in Singapore and administers the Spring Prototyping Assistance Scheme (PAS) for budding hardware startup companies. 

OMG is proud to be the secretariat of the Southeast Asia Makerspace Network (SEAMNET), a founding member of the Singapore Makers Association and an Autodesk Authorised Training Centre & Education Partner.
profile_positions.title: Chief Operating Officer

profile_positions.description:
NomadAsia is an online intermediary platform allowing travelers to book their travel activities online before their holidays. This eliminates uncertainties facing both travelers such as not being able to book a good tour online, as well as tour operators facing high transaction costs handling B2C markets. NomadAsia's carefully curated list of operators, reinforced with social review system ensures high quality tours are always offered to everyone! 

NomadAsia alpha product is already launched and is in testing phase. Beyond the integral involvement in testing the hypothesis of the business model and idea, I'm also involved in the design of the website and feel. NomadAsia is actively seeking mentors and investors within the travel industry to have a good mental sparring and learn from each other.

An avid explorer at heart, I love to travel and explore nooks and crannies of every city that I visit, packing bits of adventure wherever I go! If you're new in Singapore and looking to meet an aspiring entrepreneur, drop me a line!
profile_positions.title: Cofounder - Traveller

profile_positions.description:
Within the startup, my role was to push out and market our platform for General Practitioners and Private Medical Specialists to use for their clinical drug purchases. Heavily involved in the initial testing of market hypothesis, hitting the grounds and knocking door to door at hospitals to seek audience with doctors. Developed and executed customer acquisition strategy for getting user base as well as being the main designer for the team, creating all necessary artwork required for publishing. This multi-hatting of roles was extremely interesting and rewarding as it was integral to the challenge of running a startup company.    

Highs:
1. Co-created the MedF1.com from scratch, together with my co-founders, Toh Hong Pang and Ryan Teo. 
2. Partnered with a clinical chain transacting over 100k of drug purchases in a single week.
3. Alarmed the Sales Manager of one of the biggest Pharmaceutical company in the world, that one of her most important clients are no longer interfacing with her sales representatives but with MedF1.com.

Unboxs Solutions powers MedF1.com, an online drug procurement platform allowing doctors to manage their drug inventory and ordering process all in one place. 

Unboxs Solutions believed that Doctors, Nurses and Clinical Assistants should devote their effort to the healthcare service of patients in their clinic. MedF1 replaces the need for clinics to manually call up pharmaceutical companies every week for drug replenishments so that both time and resource is better spent serving patients. The clinic-specific drug pricing and spending analysis of MedF1 helps clinics to be on top of new drug inventories that are introduced to market in the highly competitive pharmaceutical industry. 

http://www.MedF1.com/
profile_positions.title: Cofounder, Sales
